title: [Large-scale] Simulation and Statistical Analysis-Based Microlearning for Improving University Instructors' Language Education Digital Literacy

context.prior_knowledge: Basic statistical analysis and digital tool proficiency, comprehension of core language education theories (grammar, vocabulary, reading comprehension)
context.additional_context: A course for practicing professionals to strengthen informatization competencies in language education. It is structured around practical tasks such as text analysis and digital content creation.

learning_goals: Learners will derive language education informatization environment design strategies using simulation tools
Learners can quantitatively assess the correlation between language education datasets by applying regression analysis techniques.

Learners can collect and analyze results of language education effectiveness indicators (e.g., improvements in reading comprehension and expressive skills) through digital platforms and apply them to practical tasks.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
